content: To begin diagnosing this, please disable any email scanner in your antivirus product and try again. They are quite good at messing up at the first hurdle when email has attachments.

content: If they do not load, I guess you get some sort of error message. What is it? (verbatim please)
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
As Thunderbird does not use the term Suspected Spam so I am sort of guessing here.

Historically there have been antivirus programs that meddled in the email space and put all sorts of labels on mail (usually in the subject line)about spam and scams.

There are also server side tools deployed by some mail server operators that put similar labels on mail traversing their mail server for delivery. Generally server operators quarantine suspected spam on the server however, or simply delete it or even refuse delivery. Therefore you are probably looking at your antivirus product as a source of the labels. As I said at the beginning, I am sort of guessing as the only sure thing here is that Thunderbird is not the source.

You are not the first ask such a question. Nor are you the first to be given similar advice. https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/17fzhow/thunderbird_subject_line_changed_to_suspected/
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hello there We have read the message. We try to help

You are permanently on a blacklist after using your email accounts. The moment you clearly no longer receive emails in your inbox due to this, you are guilty of the term "Bounce", which means that you have used email software where spam-like activities have been found. You can use free online software to check whether they have registered for this. For example, a DNS checker or Debouncer.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there


The method is if you are registered and you use an IP blacklist for email software, you can assume that better behavior will pay off and you will show less and less spam behavior that you will be removed from this list again. It is true that if you were to continuously appear on this list, it would become increasingly difficult to get off this list.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there


You can request a "delistings list" which would probably require you to fill out a form and adhere to the rules.


Greetings firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there

There are a number of lists you can end up with, such as the term white listing and also gray listing. This term already tells you what it means. White listing is for approving email addresses, servers, and IP addresses.

gray listing is for the use of to prevent you from ending up on a blacklist.



Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there


If you have time for this, you can visit the online site "Spamhaus" and register there. You will then be asked if you can enter your IP address for further assistance. Register here and enter your IP address or domain name of the relevant one and ask to look it up. You can easily follow the instructions to get rid of this list.

If you also have a Microsoft account, you can also register here and log in to the Microsoft delistings portal. Here you can request the well-known deregistration form regarding your current situation? This will be recorded and processed for an assessment.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Solved:-)

Hello everyone, I've found the cause of the problem.

It was my mail signatures, which I had saved in html files. The css in them broke the ListItems. Now everything is working fine again.

Maybe helpful for one or the other who runs into this problem.
creator: patrick.lanners

content:
I have marked your reply as solving the issue as that will make it available to search engines like Google and Yahoo.

One of the reasons the article discussing signatures suggests writing the signature in Thunderbird is the CSS issue. Some sources like word processors load everything but the kitchen sink into CSS that is simply not used in the HTML, but makes the email much larger and can cause all sorts of unintended consequences.

See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/signatures
creator: MattAuSupport

content: First, I suggest looking in File Explorer to verify that the inbox itself is that size, and not a combination of files. I mention this because sometimes users report a large size when, in fact, it is multiple temporary files from failed compactions. Normally, compacting the file works. If you exit TB and delete the inbox & inbox.msf, thunderbird will repopulate it on restart. No need to recreate the account.

content: That explains why removing the account didn't cause it to restore. POP accounts are resident on your PC, whereas IMAP accounts are resident on the server. That allows a user to delete the files on PC and they will repopulate. I'm glad you took the safe approach of backing up first.

creator: bwfairhall

content:
Ještě jsem dohledával informace v mezinárodním support fóru a narazil jsem na toto: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1869543 Zdá se, že problém je převážně na počítačích HP a Win11, což je i můj. Jistým řešením je vytvoření .bat souboru, který manuálně spustí službu zařazování tisku. Tzn. v poznámkovém bloku napsat následující:

net stop spooler net start spooler net stop spooler del C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS\*.shd del C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS\*.spl net start spooler

Toto uložit např. na plochu s názvem souboru *.bat a po té, co Thundrbird vypne službu zařazování, spustit tento .bat soubor jako správce, čímž dojde k obnově služby zařazování tisku a je možno normálně tisknout ze všech aplikací. Hrozné řešení, ale zatím to nejlepší, které jsem našel. A funguje.
creator: j.wyderka

content:
https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb

Passwords are managed and stored encrypted. Account settings are essentially public knowledge and require no special storage. Hence none of the account settings dialogs have manage password options. They are reserved for the password manager.

content:
Generally I see a few issues with filters;

  • Filters do not execute because Thunderbird is busy with it's internal database. Rebuilding it sometime helps there. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database
  • The time between checking of mail has been set to something unrealistic like 2 minutes so the whole sequence of actions fails to complete with a first mail fetch before the next runs over the top of it preventing the filters ever actually getting out of the starting box.
  • For IMAP accounts filters that rely on the body content of the email should only be executed after classification as a timing issue means that the body is frequently not downloaded when the filter executes.

I can not see any recent bugs related to filters, nor any discussion on the beta testing list.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
have added T to Windows Firewall allowed.

Thunderbird is not a service accepting connections from the outside. Unless you're running a 3rd-party firewall, the Windows built-in firewall is not blocking outgoing connections. So what exactly do you think you have allowed? Don't mess with firewall settings unless you know exactly what you're doing.

No other antivirus on the machine.

Since you're using Windows 10, your anti-virus s/w is Windows Defender, and it's active. Try to start Windows 10 in safe mode with networking enabled.

Does the problem go away?

Windows safe mode disables anti-virus software. This is a troubleshooting step, not a solution.

Should I delete the -1 -2 -3 -4 folders - and the associated msf files?

No, most likely the -4 folder (the one with the greatest no.) is the one you're actually using. You'll have to confirm this first before deleting anything. Look for 'Local Directory' in your Account Settings.

content: Anti-virus software is most likely the culprit. Create an exception in your anti-virus software for the Thunderbird profile folder, so that the anti-virus real-time scanner will not scan it. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-to-find-your-profile

content:
Great question. In order of operation, this is the way it works. When I create a presentation inside Sage Promo Products, I can either choose "Email Link" or "Email Link with attached PDF". See attachments. When I click on "Email Link", Sage platform will usually populate an email inside TB and show the link. Currently, this option is broken.

The later option is send "Email Link with attached PDF" which when pressed, an email populates inside a TB and show an email with the product link and PDF. This part works fine.

How is it that when I click on "Email Link", the link is not populating, however Email Link with attached PDF works properly?

I continue to get a "mapi-1" error. How can Sage Tech Support team help fix this?
creator: bobby24

content: I've no idea why one works but not the other. Possibly due to a mismatch between TB and Sage, e.g. TB is 64-bit while Sage is 32-bit, or vice versa. Or, lack of complete MAPI support in either app.
creator: sfhowes

content: I get that, but can you ask someone else? It worked for 5 years prior to this month. I know it works and it did for a long time.
creator: bobby24

content: If it worked before, maybe Sage is 32-bit but TB updated and installed the 64-bit version over the 32-bit version. Help/About TB to see 32 or 64-bit. Apparently, Sage comes in 32 and 64-bit. Note this has no connection to your 64-bit Windows, which supports 32 and 64-bit apps.
creator: sfhowes

content: Ciao, devi essere più dettagliato. Qual è il provider della tua casella email? La casella è configurata come IMAP o POP3? Oltre che da Thunderbird accedi da altri dispositivi (browser, app, smartphone, etc.) Thunderbird visualizza qualche messaggio di errore quando provi a scaricare la posta?
creator: @next

content: sure. here are the steps: - exit thunderbird - locate profile - click imapmail profile and then copy the yahoo profile to the server. Give it whatever name you like - start thunderbird - highlight account and right-click - select settings - click to 'server settings' - click the bottom item that points to account and change to the location of the server account that you just set up. - this will require a thunderbird restart - on restart, recheck to see that all is working ok. You can now delete the folder on your PC that you copied from.
creator: davidsk

content: Changing medium to large is an HTML process. You might first consider why you want recipients to receive your emails in a large font. Some may find it offensive, as they may prefer to set their own font size. Your replies are also in large font when replying in HTML. You may need to change settings to always send HTML, regardless of style changes. When you receive messages, are they of acceptable size? That is, my real question is whether you want recipients to see messages in a large font, or is it just for yourself to see messages in large font? This may seem picky, but the solutions are different for each. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks, David. There are 6 sizes to choose from when I look at the HTML settings - Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Extra Large, and Huge . I only want to go from Medium, which I believe is default, up one to large. This makes it easier to see what I am typing. When I have sent a new email with the slightly larger font, replies from the recipient maintain that slightly larger font in my portion of the thread, which is helpful as well, but usually not in the reply. I assume that the recipient also sees the slightly larger font size. All this seems acceptable to me and I assume to the recipient. You asked if incoming messages are too small. They usually come in at the slightly smaller font size (Medium) that I started with. It would also be nice to view these incoming messages in the slightly larger font size. Given the size that my (older) eyes need, I would like incoming messages to also appear slightly larger (Large). I hope this all makes sense! Thanks again. Look forward to your response! Rick
creator: rccswitzel

content:
Ok, check this earlier response I gave: 

  https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1437527

in summary, I encourage medium font as that allows recipient to pick their own. The other settings ensure that you see your desired font whether sending or receiving, whether HTML messages or plain text. Follow the steps in detail about the Latin and Other writing systems and this has always been a 100% success. If you have difficulties. please let me know. As I am also not as young as I'd like to be, I respect your issue. :)
creator: davidsk

content: On the Calendar tab, check Events & Tasks, Find Events. Press Alt if the Menu Bar with Events & Tasks is hidden.

However, the window was totally empty, EXCEPT for a very small square box in the upper corner. So, what the heck, I clicked it and, voila a list of choices appeared, one choice was "Title".

Problem resolved.

content: First, please understand that you are posting to the people who have no authority for anything. Your complaint is posted daily here, multiple times, and has been happening since 102 was rolled out in 2022. There is a 'fix' for the dreaded threading feature. Let me know if interested. It's messy, but it works. Want to avoid all future updates? Let me know, as it's doable. Another possibility is to download ver 91. It works smoothly and the profile is compatible, once you delete the compatibility.ini file. It is possible to set up 91 with updates disabled. I have a copy working now and most addons for it are still available. HOWEVER, you are dissatisfied, adding your voice at connect.microsoft.org may help. Click to IDEAS and voice your displeasure there. Let me know. But please, we're just workerbees here. :)

content:
David,

I changed 'Settings | Updates' to "Check but let me choose ..." Hopefully that will stop the automatic updates.

If you have a 'fix' for threading, and if it's not too much trouble for you - let me know and I'll give it a try. Otherwise right now I'm happy to leave this version (115.7.0 32-bit) alone and fix the threading for each folder, as I find them. I think 'threading' is enabled for each new folder created - so I'll just deal with it.

(By 'threading', as I use it above, I mean: 'View | Sort By' and select "unthreaded".)

As to dropping back to version '91' - I'll keep that option open for the future, if needed.

Thank you for your time to respond and for the offers to help.
creator: hoeldd533

content: Changing the default is rather simple: - click to settings and scroll down to 'config editor' near bottom of the pane and click it - enter mailnews.default_view_flags and change value to 0 and save - I suggest entering config editor again and entering that text just to be sure that is 0. Sometimes, it doesn't et set. This sets the default for any new folder to unthreaded. I do share your view and, like you, I hope things get better.
creator: davidsk

content: David, Got it. Thank you.
creator: hoeldd533

content:
It is even covered in the threading support article, but for some reason folk keep appearing in support forums asking for the process to be personally delivered to them.

How can it be made clearer? So that people actually follow the written instructions. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird#w_changing-default-threading-mode
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
There is no phone support. None, so I will remove you phone number from this public forum.

The error message is very clear. Google says you signin in not valid, so wither your password or user name are not correct, or you are not using the oAuth2.0 authentication method in your account settings.

The first thing to do is follow this link and ensure that getting mail is actually enabled in Gmail. Sometime it gets turned off as it is not a default when folk go through one of those security checks google push out.

The second step is to disable any email scanning in your antivirus product and they can cause all sorts of issues with authentication for mail, as can VPN's. They have grown in popularity in recent years and offer questionable obscurity. Unfortunately their very process of hiding where you are falls over any number of protection tools with provider who know where you access the internet from usually, like Google, Facebook etc.

Next is to look in account settings and post your account settings for connecting to the gmail server. If you connection setting include normal password then change that to oauth before making any further posts and try again.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: The referenced discussion doesn't help me. I am an octogenarian tech dinosaur who has used and appreciated Thunderbird for years because a) I was already using Firefox for privacy reasons, b)Thunderbird enabled me to handle web-based e-mail accounts in one place on my desktop, and c) I found it so easy to use. I'm not about to start pretending I'm tech-savvy and poking into the innards of the application. I tried the changes I could find under "View", but they didn't help. I thought that I could revert to a previous version which might not have this problem (I have done this with other apps), and I did find a listing of previous versions, but apparently you have to be tech-savvy to figure out how to install them. I don't know why, if I put the cursor on the line between the message list and the current message itself, it shows the symbol that says you can move the line, but the line doesn't move. I applaud a comment I saw somewhere else on a Thunderbird community page, that new releases shouldn't go out for general use by the non-technical user community until the bugs have been found and worked out (if this were specified as a beta I probably wouldn't have downloaded it). I realize this is a minor problem, but it irritates me again every time I open Thunderbird. I have always felt I should update major applications regularly for security reasons, but after this I'm not updating Thunderbird any more. Additional notes: I finally found the Card View and don't like it at all. I also found that the symbol for moving the line permits you to display more messages in the message list, but not fewer.
creator: msegall
